courseDescription:
This course will introduce you to the important aspects of electrochemical reactions, how they react with the mixed potential theory, as well as the formation of the Helmholtz double-layer and the Tafel equation. You will learn about the area effect on the corrosion of the active component connected to a noble component, as well as galvanic coupling between two active metals in an electrolyte.

You will study the features and elements of passivation, as well as the interaction between polarization and the Pourbaix diagram. Learn about Faraday's two-staged experiment on converting iron with HNO3 (nitric acid) solution from the passive to the active stage, as well as the ennoblement of metal in relation to passivity. The interaction of cathodic and anodic polarization plots when a system goes into passivation mode will also be highlighted in this course.

Furthermore, you will gain an understanding of how to calculate the Pilling-Bedworth ratio in different metals, as well as the two fundamental aspects of oxidation. You will also learn how to plot the Ellingham diagram, as well as how an oxidation process occurs in metal deficient diffusion of the interstitial cation. This free online course will be of great value to anyone with an interest in electrochemical reactions in corrosion – register now and expand your knowledge today.

modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the two important aspects of electrochemical reactions, as well as their interactions with mixed potential theory. You will also be introduced to the concepts of Tafel equation, cathodic and anodic reactions, as well as how to plot appropriate graphs representing the reactions and the formation of the Helmholtz double-layer.

modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the evolution of microstructure in pearlite, the concept of an optical microscope, as well as their formation. modules.details: Area Effect Factor and Galvanic Coupling in Active Metals
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the different values of half-cell, anodic and cathodic reactions, as well as the parallel line of individual Tafel lines for hydrogen evolution reaction on zinc and platinum. You will also be introduced to the area effect on the corrosion of an active component, as well as the galvanic coupling between two active metals in an electrolyte.

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Corrosion Rate of Active Metals in a Concentration Controlled Environment
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the two segments of cathodic protection which are the sacrificial anode and impressed current cathodic protection, as well as the effect of magnesium and zinc on iron corrosion when they are galvanically coupled. You will also be introduced to how corrosion current density can be affected in both activation, as well as concentration controlled environment. The relationship between velocity and corrosion rate will also be highlighted in this module.
